content:
That sounds like an amazing experience for your family! The hands-on approach of the cooking class really allowed your kids to engage with the culinary process and take ownership of their creations. It's wonderful that they were proud of themselves and enjoyed presenting their dishes to the rest of the class.

It's great to hear that they loved the kalua pig and were fascinated by the traditional Hawaiian method of cooking. It's always exciting to see kids develop an interest in different cultures and cuisines, and it's even more special when they can learn about it in a hands-on way.

I completely agree that the cooking class helped your kids develop an appreciation for the local culture and cuisine. By learning about the history and significance of the dishes, they were able to connect with the local people and their traditions on a deeper level. It's experiences like these that can create lifelong memories and a deeper appreciation for different cultures.

I'm curious, did your kids have a favorite part of the Hawaiian culture or tradition that they learned about during the cooking class? Was there something that resonated with them or sparked their curiosity?
